feed.title: Category: Video Games | MECHAkunEX Media Diary

entry.title: Game: Professor Layton and the Last Specter (DS, 2011) (3)
entry.content: I've been plugging along in the game doing one a day. I got the train mini-game today. It's a neat version of the car mini-game from the last one. The idea of dealing with multiple trains at a time sounds like it will be challenging.

entry.title: Game: Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! (NES, 1987) (12)
entry.content:
I wanted to show the wife this game and have her try it out. She beat Glass Joe by decision after losing by decision and having me show her how it was done. She lost on the next fight but I took the continue and took it all the way to Soda Popinski. It was pretty rad to go through the whole game up to that point and show off to her a bit. My code this time around was different though:

255 113 7842

entry.title: Game: Donkey Kong Country Returns (Wii, 2010) (5)
entry.content: We played three levels tonight. It was pretty fun. My wife and I had a bit of a disagreement about what was fun about the game. She really likes collecting everything and exploring the area, trying to do harder things. In contrast, I find that annoying and prefer to just go through the obstacle course as fast as possible. But, the secret of marital bliss is she tells me what to do, and I do it, so I repented. =)

entry.title: Game: Valkyria Chronicles (PS3, 2008) (6)
entry.content:
I played for about three hours tonight. The story battles are getting pretty rough and un-cheese-able, which is really fun because it forces me to try different things. I got a really bad score in the second woodland battle, which was kinda sad, so I did another skirmish so I could get the XP I missed. I really enjoyed using the tank a lot in the woodland battle though.

Total: 13:30

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 4: Chapters of the Chosen (DS, 2007) (6)
entry.content:
I played for about three hours and did a lot of exploring and learning about the many quests I need to finish to get all the Zenithian equipment. There's a lot to keep track of and remember. I feel like I need to write it down. I think in a modern game there would be in-game markers of some kind that might make it to easy or feel to "fetch questy", but when you actually have to remember what's going on, it feels more real and fun. It's an interesting thing.

Here's my list: - The sword is near a waterfall - I have the water soaking stone - I need to go to a mine near the French stuff

Total time: 16:51
